title: @Riot KateyKhaos When is Malzahar getting a new skin???
body:
Okay, he got his mage update. He probably won't get any more changes for a long time. HIs last skin was the Snow Day Malz in 2014. Most of skins are recolors... 

I'm tired of my main not even getting a proper skin. He has suffered from just getting recolors. He's one of the older champions too, so the amount of skins that he has for a six year period is pathetic, yet when I see champs like Katarina have way more and is now getting another skin!!! Same for Ashe too!

LIke you have too many champions that REALLY need new skins, and players are tired of freaking waiting... this game might not even be around when he gets a new skin rofl.........

replies.body:
Hey - 

We generally don't announce if/when a new champion has a skin in the works, so I don't have any details to share with you there. 

Since Malzahar's update, you're correct that he likely won't see any drastic changes, making him eligible for a skin. With that said, a fair amount prior (even before the mage update was announced), Malzahar was ineligible for a skin because we knew various kit changes were going to be made. Making a skin that may/may not need to be ripped apart due to the update is a. twice the work and b. players may be pretty upset that they bought x skin, and now it's nothing like it originally was. When we can avoid these two instances, we absolutely try to.

Are there any plans to update/ improve his existing skins as well?

The most recent reason to justify that would be his new passive, which ruins those skins, but general concerns like a) unfulfilled potential for different particle effects (Golden animations on prince? Sand animations on djinn?); b) interesting concepts/ ideas that did not end up being as cool as they could have been (djinn's skin is kind of bland, overlord could probably be more epic looking); c) old models and old art.

Nothing at the moment. IIRC, texture re-balances were done last year on his skins, but that's all that was on the docket for updating Malzahar in terms of visual updates.

For most of his skins, they are priced at 520 RP, including Djinn, which would only warrant a new slightly different model at texture at that point in time. Even Overlord Malzahar, one of the first 975 RP skins only meant a new model and texture back in 2011. 

I get where you're coming from in this case, and he's an older dude who has potential to be updated, buuut, in the same vein, there are others who are in the same boat. We realize this. I don't have answers for you as to who would get updates first and why - it's not the type of thing my team handles. 

Best case scenario for Malzahar at this time would for him to receive a new skin that's 975 RP+, giving him at least some new particles.

> 
> Best case scenario for Malzahar at this time would for him to receive a new skin that's 975 RP+, giving him at least some new particles.

I can understand that there are many other champions that also need this sort of updating. But I wonder: shouldn't the visual effects of his new passive put him at a higher priority than usual for a visual update? There are many champion skins that do need updating, true, but not all of them got screwed by a new, recent effect, right? For most of them, you can still enjoy their old skins, no matter how limited they are, but playing with a pink vizier malzahar or a pink prince malzahar is just not what you bought them for. Couldn't this additional hurdle justify making him a higher priority than your average "old champion" that do not have this problem?

Anyways, thanks for the answer.

This is a bit out of my realm in terms of expertise - I don't work on Champion Update, so I don't have a ton of context into what's getting updated and why, or what the priority of content should be. 

From what I understand, the updated are based around what the skin originally had. So, if it had base particles, it would still use base particles. If the skin had new particles, we would give them a new particle that was cohesive with the thematic of the skin.  Of course, the exception here would be large updates, such as Poppy where entire champion changes, and warrants an entire new kit.

Thanks for responding to my post here and all that. Sadly this is the right answer I'm just bummed that my main man Malzahar isn't a clear focus in terms of making money for riot lol. I just feel visually he's been abandoned for the most part only getting touch ups when need be. It's sad though I'm practically almost Willing for anything at this point...

I figured this wasn't what you were looking for, but I figured honestly is the best policy in this case. D: I'm sorry this dude hasn't had a ton of love. I'd be happy to bring it up on my team in terms of giving him a new skin, though. :)
